autoop.core.ml.artifact module

class autoop.core.ml.artifact.Artifact(name: str, asset_path: str, version: str, data: bytes | ndarray, type: str | None = None, metadata: str | None = None, tags: str | None = None)[source]

Bases: object

Stores and manages metadata about assets.

Provides access to the asset path.

Provides access to the stored data.

property id: str

Generates a unique ID based on the asset path and version.

property metadata: str

Provides access to the metadata.

Provides access to the name.

autoop.core.ml.dataset module

class autoop.core.ml.dataset.Dataset(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Artifact

A class representing a dataset artifact which inherits from Artifact class.

DatasetObject = ~DatasetType
static from_dataframe(data: DataFrame, name: str, asset_path: str, version: str = '1.0.0') → DatasetType[source]

Create a Dataset instance from a pandas DataFrame.

Parameters:

  • data (pd.DataFrame) – The DataFrame to be saved as a dataset.

  • name (str) – The name of the dataset.

  • asset_path (str) – The file path where the dataset will be stored.

  • version (str) – Version of the dataset. Defaults to “1.0.0”.

Returns:

A new Dataset instance with the given data, name, and version.

Return type:

Dataset

static initialize_from_line(data: bytes, name: str, asset_path: str, version: str = '1.0.0') → DatasetType[source]

Creates a Dataset object from pre-encoded bytes data without invoking __init__.

Parameters:

  • data (bytes) – Byte-encoded CSV data.

  • name (str) – Name of the dataset.

  • asset_path (str) – Path to store the dataset.

  • version (str) – Version of the dataset.

Returns:

A Dataset object created from the byte-encoded data.

Return type:

Dataset

Returns:

The dataset in DataFrame format.

Return type:
